thread.title: Apaches dance way to TAPPS 2-5A crown
thread.title_full: Apaches dance way to TAPPS 2-5A crown - San Antonio Express-News

author: Terrence Thomas
title: Apaches dance way to TAPPS 2-5A crown
text:
Photo: Tom Reel / San Antonio Express-News Image 1 of / 1 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 1 Grace White pounds a kill through around Shea Lopez as Antonian wins the TAPPS 2-5A volleyball title by beating Incarnate Word High School 3-0 at Littleton Gym on October 22, 2015. Grace White pounds a kill through around Shea Lopez as Antonian wins the TAPPS 2-5A volleyball title by beating Incarnate Word High School 3-0 at Littleton Gym on October 22, 2015. Photo: Tom Reel / San Antonio Express-News Apaches dance way to TAPPS 2-5A crown 1 / 1 Back to Gallery Antonian volleyball coach Samantha McLure is old-school when it comes to her philsophy, a stickler for fundamentals, toughness and focus.
So how did McLure react Thursday night when her players had an impromptu dance-off during an intermission between the second and third sets of a match that would determine the TAPPS 2-5A championship? She simply smiled and laughed.
“She has definitely gotten a lot more mellower than she used to be,” Antonian senior outside hitter Emily Ramirez said of her coach. “Sometimes she’s dances with us. It’s really funny.”
The Apaches, however, were all business when it mattered, thumping rival Incarnate Word 25-11, 25-15, 25-20 at Littleton Gym to capture their third straight district championship and second straight outright. The match lasted a little more than an hour.
For more, visit ExpressNews.com
